text: There is a single thread of attitude, a single direction of flow, that joins our present time to its early burgeoning in Mediterranean civilization.
author: Arthur Erickson

text: We live in a country that used to have a can-do attitude, and now we have a 'what-can-you-do-for-me?' attitude, and what I try to do is find ways that we can develop common ground.
author: Benjamin Carson

text: Could we change our attitude, we should not only see life differently, but life itself would come to be different.
author: Katherine Mansfield

text: The ideal attitude is to be physically loose and mentally tight.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: An attitude to life which seeks fulfillment in the single-minded pursuit of wealth - in short, materialism - does not fit into this world, because it contains within itself no limiting principle, while the environment in which it is placed is strictly limited.
author: E. F. Schumacher
